text: J'adore l'espace de ce restaurant! Le bois, la grande baie vitrée, la cuisine ouverte... J'y suis allée 2 fois le midi, soupe + 1 rouleau + plat à prix très abordable! C'est bon mais ils ne mettent que 4/5 petits morceaux de viande pour un énorme plat de nouille... Je dois tester leur menu du soir avec les dumplings...
Jolie resto, bouffe excellente, prix raisonnable, grand choix de plats. À essayer plus d'une fois!
The sweet sour pork dish was amazing. Perfectly cooked and fresh. Much better  than most Chinese restaurants in Toronto. Definitely worth checking out.

J'y suis allée une seule fois mais j'ai pu goûter à 2 plats. Celui de la personne qui m'accompagnait et le mien (oui, soyez sans crainte, l'autre personne a pu goûter à mon plat)

Bon, elle a commandé un poulet pané au citron. J'ai bien aimé mais j'ai préféré mes dim sums. J'ai goûté au Chow Ha aux crevettes.. Bon, goûteux, croustillants. Présentation originale, servis à même le plat de bambou."

Très bon service, peu coûteux. J'y retournerai

J'avais le goût de manger des dumplig et aussi des plats asiatiques, j'ai bien aimé le Mei Café pour la diversité des plats que ce resto offre. En plus il y a plein de stationnement de libre dans ce coon sur st-laurent... Raison de plus pour s'y remdre sans préoccupation. Nous avons pris 4 entrées style dim sum ainsi que deux plats principals et une boisson alcoolisée pour mon chum... 77$ taxes et service inclus. 
Pad thaï est très bon et les morceaux de poissons frits sel et poivre... Vrm délicieux. Le poisson était fondant et la panure pas trop grasse. Tputes nos petites entrés étaient super savoureuses. Les dumplings sauce arachides vrm bons et les crevettes dim sum vapeur vrm bons aussi. Rouleaux impériaux étaient comme tout bons rouleaux et les crevettes enrobées c'était bon aussi mais simple.

I've only been here once but I had a lovely relaxing meal and look forward to returning. Family run, friendly service, warm wooden decor, kind of romantic but laid back, big windows on St Laurent, and very tasty Chinese food made with fresh ingredients. We shared battered fried broccoli and a mess of vegetarian dumplings. No greasy heavy feeling after, and no disappointment from choosing the veggie route, the flavours were subtle and bright. 

I have walked by this place a million times and had no idea it was Chinese food and no idea it was good, I'm so happy to finally have seen the light.

I have been going to this place for close to 25 years at least. 

They have wonderful steamed dumplings! The trick is order lots of dumplings and share! They also have great fried rice. 

Also, the fried broccoli is surprisingly delicious ! I order two plates each time.

Je suis vraiment tombée amoureuse de ce restaurant! 

L'ambiance est parfaite et la nourriture est tout simplement renversante. J'aime particulièrement les dim sum, les plats de nouilles et le boeuf à l'orange.

Vous devez tenter l'expérience!

Let's begin with the positive. The wonton soup: amazing. I want a huge bowl of it, I wish it was on the entree menu by itself. The imperial roll was interesting and was better than most restaurant I went to.

Me and my boyfriend were a bit confused by the style of the menu. Thai, Hunnan, Szechuanese there is some of everything. We both took a fish meal and I have to say it was ok. I was a bit disappointed.
J'ai vraiment adoré l'ambiance vraiment inusité pour un restauranr Thai. Le repas était vraiment intéressant et surtout délicieux ! à essayer !

I'm in love with this place. This is one of the best asian restaurant in Montreal and the best Pad Thai i ever eat. Their menu is really interesting with all kind of different dishes. All their dishe can be choose with chicken, beef, shrimp or tofu. The service is spotless and very fast. In the evening, the price is legit for the portion and for diner their price are very affordable. For diner you can have a soup + spring roll or imperial roll with your main dishe.

OMG! Where have you been all my life Cafe Mei? This place was awesome! Everything we had was delicious. The dumplings were huge compared to what you would find elsewhere. Also, I always get disappointed when eating at other dumpling/dim sum places because of the meat/fat ratio. They usually put a lot of chunks of fat. But at Cafe Mei, it was perfect! We also had the General Tao and the Sa Tsa beef. Both very good but the General Tao is what blew me away! I could eat this every day. Not too sweet (just perfectly enough), it stayed crispy until the next day. Ya...I woke up and had some right away before coffee! The prices are a bit higher BUT the portions are also way bigger! The wine list is short BUT the prices are very, very good. 

Great service. Excellent food. Fun ambiance. Fair price. I CAN'T WAIT TO COME BACK!
